stories.text: I have some research I'm looking to do on time-series in python in the coming weeks. In the longer term I do want to understand the math/stat underpinnings (I'm using Brilliant to catch up on maths), but, for now, could I make decent predictions/tests using python libraries? Perhaps by reading a layman's explanation of various outputs first (math is the limiting factor in this timeline)?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it possible to be a data science “script kiddy”?

stories.text:
Hey HN,

We wrote a short primer on DAOs and their growth over the past year, including perspectives on pitfalls and potential.

We'd love to hear your thoughts!

https://www.smallstepcap.com/decentralized-autonomous-organizations-for-the-everyman/
stories.title: An Accessible Primer for Decentralized Autonomous Organizations
